results.title: Building typing skill
results.brief_description: Examines methods pf improving typing performance by improving attitude, typing form, muscle tone, and tying patters - all important factors in increasing typing speed.

results.title: Building trades
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film showing the work of tradesmen in the construction of a house, an office block or a factory, including bricklayers, plasterers, tilers and carpenters. Discusses careers available to building tradesmen as supervisors or in their own building companies.

results.title: Building the industrial revolution
results.creator_credit: Link Film Services and Mick Gold
results.brief_description: A film about the elements that created the factory system, the buildings that housed it, and the social changes that it generated - a story told by the industrial architecture of the East Midlands, the area in which the first factories were built.
results.description: A film about the elements that created the factory system, the buildings that housed it, and the social changes that it generated - a story told by the industrial architecture of the East Midlands, the area in which the first factories were built.

results.title: Building synergy
results.creator_credit: R and R Productions and Ron V. Brown
results.brief_description: Outlines the co-operative action in Victoria between schools and the community for use of facilities such as halls, libraries and theatres. Schools designed with community use in mind are working very successfully, with co-ordination of facilities between school and community. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Building on research
results.brief_description: Sponsored research helps maintain quality and high production. Studies of soil mechanics led to new developments in footings allowing greater scope in planning buildings; a moisture meter led to new uses for hardwoods treated with preservatives; finger jointing prevents timber wastage; protected working spaces are provided by laminated trusses; control of firing procedures eliminates expansion of brickwork; strengthening of concrete and devices to cope with problems occurring with high buildings.
results.description: Sponsored research helps maintain quality and high production. Studies of soil mechanics led to new developments in footings allowing greater scope in planning buildings; a moisture meter led to new uses for hardwoods treated with preservatives; finger jointing prevents timber wastage; protected working spaces are provided by laminated trusses; control of firing procedures eliminates expansion of brickwork; strengthening of concrete and devices to cope with problems occurring with high buildings.

results.title: Building of the earth
results.brief_description: Examines volcanic action and plate tectonics, the extreme cold of polar and high altitude regions, and how living organisms have adapted those environments. Teachers advised to view in advance so that segments may be identified as appropriate to concentration spans.

results.title: Building Lindy's house
results.brief_description: Illustrates the selection of a block of land suitable for building a home. Shows the specialised work of different tradesmen employed in building a house and points out how the different building processes are co-ordinated.

results.title: Building houses
results.brief_description: A survey of the major operations involved in the construction of a modern house: preparation of plans by architects; stripping of site and laying of foundations; subsequent work of bricklayers, carpenters, tilers, plumbers, glaziers, electricians, plasterers, painters and others. The commentary points out that the finished house is the result of the combined efforts of a large team of craftsmen.
results.description: A survey of the major operations involved in the construction of a modern house: preparation of plans by architects; stripping of site and laying of foundations; subsequent work of bricklayers, carpenters, tilers, plumbers, glaziers, electricians, plasterers, painters and others. The commentary points out that the finished house is the result of the combined efforts of a large team of craftsmen.
